column4: I had an issue while installing xubuntu, the select and install software portion of the install failed.
I'm using the alternate PC install

Ok, complete noob question, I just installed xubuntu, and I'm a BRAND new user to linux. I'm trying to run a file I've downloaded from ATi, the drivers. (ati-driver-installer08.28.8.run) How do I run it?
read that, its an easier way to install ati binary drivers
I don't have internet on the laptop.
hmm... you could download it from repo and install it "offline"... you need atleast fglrx and some kernel modules...
this is going to take some getting used to .__.
if you had interent, it would just be "sudo apt-get instal server-xorg-driver-ati"
so just type that in the terminal and it'll get it and install it for me?
when I have internet of course.
yes, if you have internet access. but you may need to change the driver in /etc/X11/xorg.conf
so you install that driver with "sudo apt-get install xorg-driver-fglrx" and edit with this "sudo nano /etc/X11/xorg.conf" and change "Driver          "ati"" to "Driver "fglrx" then restart gnome
it seems to be in universe repo
